trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates that a file can be used for asynchronous reading and writing.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxx x xxxx xxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates that a file is automatically deleted when it is no longer in use.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxx x xxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xx xx xxxxxx xx xxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates that a file is encrypted and can be decrypted only by using the same user account used for encryption.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxx x xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates that the file is accessed randomly.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The system can use this as a hint to optimize file caching.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxx xxx xxx xxxx xx x xxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates that the file is to be accessed sequentially from beginning to end.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xx xx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx.

trans-unit.source: The system can use this as a hint to optimize file caching.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxx xxx xxx xxxx xx x xxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: If an application moves the file pointer for random access, optimum caching may not occur; however, correct operation is still guaranteed.
trans-unit.target: Xx xx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxx xxxxx$ xxxxxxx$ xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates that the system should write through any intermediate cache and go directly to disk.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxxxxxxx xx xxxx.$$x$$x
